AddNodeToSubset.description: Places a node inside a subset, by annotating that node

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

in_subset.description: subset that the element is being placed inside.

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

AddNodeToSubset.title: AddNodeToSubset

Annotation.description: owl annotations. Not to be confused with annotations sensu GO
Annotation.title: Annotation

ChangeSetSummaryStatistic.description: A summary statistic for a set of changes of the same type, grouped by zero or more node properties

property_value_set.description: Summary statistic is grouped by these constraints

ChangeSetSummaryStatistic.title: ChangeSetSummaryStatistic

ClassCreation.description: A node creation where the owl type is 'class'

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

node_id.description: id of a node to be created

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

ClassCreation.title: ClassCreation

ClassNode.description: A node that is a class
ClassNode.title: ClassNode

Configuration.description: The meaning of operations can be configured
Configuration.title: Configuration

about.description: The 'focus' entity on which the change operates

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

Edge.description: A relationship between two nodes. We assume owlstar or similar for existential restrictions
Edge.title: Edge

EdgeCreation.description: An edge change in which a de-novo edge is created. The edge is potentially annotated in the same action.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

EdgeCreation.title: EdgeCreation

EdgeDeletion.description: An edge change in which an edge is removed. All edge annotations/properies are removed in the same action.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

EdgeDeletion.title: EdgeDeletion

EdgeLogicalInterpretationChange.description: An edge change where the subjet, object, and predicate are unchanged, but the logical interpretation changes

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

EdgeLogicalInterpretationChange.title: EdgeLogicalInterpretationChange

EdgeObsoletion.description: An edge change in which an edge is obsoleted.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

EdgeObsoletion.title: EdgeObsoletion

EdgeRewiring.description: An edge change where one node is replaced with another, as in the case of obsoletion with replacement

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

EdgeRewiring.title: EdgeRewiring

InstanceNode.description: A node that is an individual
InstanceNode.title: InstanceNode

LogicalAxiomChange.description: A simple change where a logical axiom is changed, where the logical axiom cannot be represented as an edge

about.description: The 'focus' entity on which the change operates

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

LogicalAxiomChange.title: LogicalAxiomChange

MultiNodeObsoletion.description: A complex change consisting of multiple obsoletions.

associated_change_set.description:
All changes associated with a set of obsoletions. This change set is the composed change set rather than the set of individual changes. For example, if previous state is:
  `A subClassOf B subClassOf C subClassOf D`
and we obsolete {B,C}, then the individual changes are `A moves from B to C` and `B moves from C to D`, but the composed change set is `A moves from B to D`

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

MultiNodeObsoletion.title: MultiNodeObsoletion

NameBecomesSynonym.description: A node synonym where the name NAME of an node NODE moves to a synonym, and NODE receives a new name. This change consists of compose of (1) a node rename where NAME is replaced by a different name (2) a new synonym

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NameBecomesSynonym.title: NameBecomesSynonym

NewSynonym.description: A node synonym change where a de-novo synonym is created

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NewSynonym.title: NewSynonym

NewTextDefinition.description: A node change where a de-novo text definition is created

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NewTextDefinition.title: NewTextDefinition

Node.description: Any named entity in an ontology. May be a class, individual, property
Node.title: Node

NodeAnnotationChange.description: A node change where the change alters node properties/annotations. TODO

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeAnnotationChange.title: NodeAnnotationChange

NodeAnnotationReplacement.description: A node annotation change where the change replaces a particular property value. TODO

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeAnnotationReplacement.title: NodeAnnotationReplacement

NodeCreation.description: a node change in which a new node is created

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

node_id.description: id of a node to be created

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeCreation.title: NodeCreation

NodeDeepening.description: A node move in which a node where the destination is a proper descendant of the original location. Note that here descendant applied not just to subclass, but edges of any predicate in the relational graph

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeDeepening.title: NodeDeepening

NodeDeletion.description: Deletion of a node from the graph. Note it is recommended nodes are obsoleted and never merged, but this operation exists to represent deletions in ontologies, accidental or otherwise

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeDeletion.title: NodeDeletion

NodeDirectMerge.description: An obsoletion change in which all metadata (including name/label) from the source node is deleted and added to the target node, and edges can automatically be rewired to point to the target node

associated_change_set.description: All changes forced as a result of this obsoletion. For example, starting with `A subClassOf B subClassOf C`, if we obsolete node B, then we may decide to bundle in a node move change of A from B to C. Note: this change set is not considered a part of the obsoletion, as obsoletion is considered atomic/simple. Instead this is a reference to a change set that may exist elsewhere

has_nondirect_replacement.description: An obsoletion replacement where it is NOT valid to automatically update annotations/edges pointing at the node with its direct replacement

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeDirectMerge.title: NodeDirectMerge

NodeMove.description: A node move is a combination of deleting a parent edge and adding a parent edge, where the predicate is preserved and the object/parent node changes

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeMove.title: NodeMove

NodeObsoletion.description: Obsoletion of a node deprecates usage of that node, but does not delete it.

associated_change_set.description: All changes forced as a result of this obsoletion. For example, starting with `A subClassOf B subClassOf C`, if we obsolete node B, then we may decide to bundle in a node move change of A from B to C. Note: this change set is not considered a part of the obsoletion, as obsoletion is considered atomic/simple. Instead this is a reference to a change set that may exist elsewhere

has_direct_replacement.description: An obsoletion replacement where it IS valid to automatically update annotations/edges pointing at the node with its direct replacement

has_nondirect_replacement.description: An obsoletion replacement where it is NOT valid to automatically update annotations/edges pointing at the node with its direct replacement

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeObsoletion.title: NodeObsoletion

NodeObsoletionWithDirectReplacement.description: An obsoletion change in which information from the obsoleted node is selectively copied to a single target, and edges can automatically be rewired to point to the target node

associated_change_set.description: All changes forced as a result of this obsoletion. For example, starting with `A subClassOf B subClassOf C`, if we obsolete node B, then we may decide to bundle in a node move change of A from B to C. Note: this change set is not considered a part of the obsoletion, as obsoletion is considered atomic/simple. Instead this is a reference to a change set that may exist elsewhere

has_nondirect_replacement.description: An obsoletion replacement where it is NOT valid to automatically update annotations/edges pointing at the node with its direct replacement

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeObsoletionWithDirectReplacement.title: NodeObsoletionWithDirectReplacement

NodeObsoletionWithNoDirectReplacement.description: An obsoletion change in which there is no direct replacement

associated_change_set.description: All changes forced as a result of this obsoletion. For example, starting with `A subClassOf B subClassOf C`, if we obsolete node B, then we may decide to bundle in a node move change of A from B to C. Note: this change set is not considered a part of the obsoletion, as obsoletion is considered atomic/simple. Instead this is a reference to a change set that may exist elsewhere

has_direct_replacement.description: An obsoletion replacement where it IS valid to automatically update annotations/edges pointing at the node with its direct replacement

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

NodeObsoletionWithNoDirectReplacement.title: NodeObsoletionWithNoDirectReplacement

NodeRename.description: A node change where the name (aka rdfs:label) of the node changes

has_textual_diff.description: A representation of character-level changes on a textual literal property. For example, if a text definition may change by only a single character such as addition of a period, it is useful to be able to see this visually.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

RemovedNodeFromSubset.description: Removes a node from a subset, by removing an annotation

about.description: The node that is removed from the subset

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

in_subset.description: subset that the element is being removed from

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

subset.description: The subset from which the node is to be removed

Session.description: A session consists of a set of change sets bundled with the activities that generated those change sets
Session.title: Session

SynonymPredicateChange.description: A node synonym change where the predicate of a synonym is changed. Background: synonyms can be represented by a variety of predicates. For example, many OBO ontologies make use of predicates such as oio:hasExactSynonym, oio:hasRelatedSynonym, etc

has_textual_diff.description: A representation of character-level changes on a textual literal property. For example, if a text definition may change by only a single character such as addition of a period, it is useful to be able to see this visually.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

SynonymPredicateChange.title: SynonymPredicateChange

SynonymReplacement.description: A node synonym change where the text of a synonym is changed

has_textual_diff.description: A representation of character-level changes on a textual literal property. For example, if a text definition may change by only a single character such as addition of a period, it is useful to be able to see this visually.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

TextDefinitionReplacement.description: A node change where a text definition is modified

has_textual_diff.description: A representation of character-level changes on a textual literal property. For example, if a text definition may change by only a single character such as addition of a period, it is useful to be able to see this visually.

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

new_value.description: The value of a property held in the new instance of the ontology

old_value.description: The value of a property held in the old instance of the ontology

TextDefinitionReplacement.title: TextDefinitionReplacement

TextualDiff.description: A summarizing of a change on a piece of text. This could be rendered in a number of different ways
TextualDiff.title: TextualDiff

Transaction.description: A change that is a composition of a set of changes, where those changes are treated as a single unit. Could be a single change, or the results of an ontology diff

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change

Transaction.title: Transaction

has_undo.description: A change that reverses this change
